intro: Melicytus fasciger, commonly known as the silverwood tree, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its smooth, silver-gray bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Melicytus fasciger is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
